ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 243
ygData.msgSnippet: To answer Zanren s question, you can enhance your int/wisdom with several pieces of jewelry (+4 int rings, plat sapphire necklace, bracelets of woven grass,
ygData.messageBody:
To answer Zanren's question, you can enhance your
int/wisdom with several pieces of jewelry (+4 int
rings, plat sapphire necklace, bracelets of woven
grass, earrings +2), plus oracle robe (which adds both
wis and int), wolf fur slippers, gatorskin leggings,
stein of mogguk, pet focus items (for magicians only),
runed circlet etc. Sorry I'm trying to go by memory.

In addition, you can have a high level enchanter cast
brilliance and insight to add additional int and
wisdom. With all those items in place the stats can
really add up.

Strega
The Rathe

> Message: 1
> Date: Mon, 6 Mar 2000 09:09:11 +1300
> From: jbuckingham@...
> Subject: Gearheart
>
>
> Just in case anyone was interested, I did the
> Gearheart quest 10 times on
> the weekend, to see if there was a hidden reward in
> the style of
> bullsmasher or the fabulous compactor - my friend
> was killing him for the
> exp, he was blue to a 32-33 and I was running
> backwards and fowards turning
> in his blackbox.. The rewards I got were small
> leather boots, small leather
> writstbands, small round shield, bronze warhammer,
> bronze short sword...
> That hammer had me exited for a bit when I saw it
> appear, thinking it
> perhaps was an upgraded bullsmasher :) But so far
> the reward looks a little
> light for a level 30 quest... Though at level 20 the
> 10 attempts got me
> about 1.5 bubbles of exp :) My factilon at the time
> was Kindly, but after I
> got bored I went and killed rogue clockworks for
> scrap to try and get the
> compactor, which got my faction up to warmly, so I
> might try it a few more
> times next weekend..
>
> Voriig Kye
> Erollisi Marr.
>
>
